TITLE.P: Key-Expert/Team Leader on Justice Sector Reform of the project "Support Rule of Law Reforms in Ukraine” (PRAVO) — Expertise France

SHORT_DESCR.P: The Team Leader (TL) is coordinating the activities carried out by the project. He/she will follow justice sector developments and draw the necessary conclusions for the preparation of follow-up activities to be implemented in the project. The TL will be responsible for carrying activities under component 1.

The TL will manage the implementation and results delivery of the entire project in Ukraine, managing the Ukraine Project Team and the office of the project, assisting EF HQ with the selection and recruitment of other staff and assigning missions to short-term experts, represent the project in relations with local beneficiaries/partners as well as third parties, in co-operation with the EU Delegation.

The Team Leader (TL) is coordinating the activities carried out by the project. He/she will follow justice sector developments and draw the necessary conclusions for the preparation of follow-up activities to be implemented in the project. The TL will be responsible for carrying activities under component 1.

The TL will manage the implementation and results delivery of the entire project in Ukraine, managing the Ukraine Project Team and the office of the project, assisting EF HQ with the selection and recruitment of other staff and assigning missions to short-term experts, represent the project in relations with local beneficiaries/partners as well as third parties, in co-operation with the EU Delegation.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: Application criteria in order to establish the short list (100 points):
— Relevance of professional experiences in project design, management, coordination and implementation at international level (minimum 10 years): 30 points;
— Relevance of professional experiences as project manager in international projects providing technical assistance to judiciary reforms (minimum 5 years): 30 points;
— Relevance of professional experiences in managing EU funded projects and/or working with EU procedures: 20 points;
— Relevance of experience in team management (long and short term experts): 10 points;
— Relevance of professional experiences in projects in Ukraine or eastern Europe countries: 5 points;
— Relevance of linguistic skills: excellent command of English, Ukrainian and/or Russian as distinctive asset: 5 points.

OBJECT_DESCR.EU_PROGR_RELATED: “Support Rule of Law Reforms in Ukraine” (PRAVO)

SUITABILITY.P: 1) Resume stating credentials and references including company names, phone contacts and emails (template given in the dossier)
2) Evidence of the company registration (legal personality of the expert)

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: — University diploma (preferably in law) or equivalent (relevant professional qualification).
— The TL should possess an excellent command of both written and spoken English as well as solid knowledge of Ukrainian and/or Russian.
— Excellent knowledge and understanding of transition.

— proactive approach and outgoing personality, results- and not activity-driven Excellent, proven organisational and people and project management skills, preferably (also) in a multi-cultural environment.
— Capacity to establish effective working relations with Ukrainian authorities; including at senior level and to ensure an efficient co-operation with the EU Delegation;
— Proven track record of providing adequate visibility to projects and their achievements.
— Minimum 15 years of general professional experience.

— The TL should possess extensive, at least 10 years, both domestic and international work experience in managerial and administrative positions with a proven track record of delivering results that made a difference;
— Experience as project manager (at least 5 years) in international projects providing technical assistance;
— Experience in policy formulation, research and reporting;
— Work experience in providing technical assistance to judiciary reforms.

INFO_ADD.P: Applicable regulation: French Ordonnance no. 2015-899 of 23.7.2015 and implementing Decree no. 2016-360 of 25.3.2016 (articles 71, 72 and 73).

The procedure will take place in 2 stages. The candidate is invited to submit his expression of interest to the tender within the time limit indicated by the present notice. For the next step, unless a candidate express formerly his disagreement, the tendering period shall last 10 days. Shortlisted experts will then be invited to take part in interviews. Only experts who provided the documentation as set forth in section III will be assessed on the basis of their capacity to fulfil the tasks set out in this call for expressions of interest.

Following the adoption of the program “Support Rule of Law Reforms in Ukraine” (PRAVO) in November 2017 by the European Neighborhood Instrument’s Committee, Expertise France has been identified to implement the 1st axis of intervention “Support to justice sector reforms” (PRAVO-Justice) through indirect management.

The project shall enforce practical fair access to justice for all, based on the rule of law and respect of common European democratic values and standards. The PRAVO-JUSTICE addresses the needs of Ukraine to accomplish the reform of the Justice Sector Institutions (JSIs). The scope of the project covers the objectives of the EU — Ukraine Associated Agreement and also the Justice Sector Reform Strategy 2015-20 (JSRS) and its Action Plan (JSRS AP). It aims to strengthen the justice system and provides for a number of complex activities targeting strategic priorities and specific actions resulting from mentioned policy making documents. The project with a budget of 15 million € on 3 years will be based in Kyiv and deploy a team composed of 3 International Key-Experts and 5 National Key-Experts for the whole duration of the project. It is structured around four components:
Component 1 focuses on supporting justice sector institutions to improve strategic planning, reform implementation and budgeting.
Component 2 focuses on the reform of the judiciary (and public prosecution). Reforms will be showcased in at least four model courts to be established in cooperation with component 4.
Component 3 deals with enforcement of court decisions in civil and administrative cases; enforcement of ECHR judgments and the execution of criminal sanctions, notably through probation.

Component 4 focuses on the provision of adequate IT and infrastructure solutions to the Justice Sector Institutions and, in particular, to the "Model Courts" to be established in cooperation with component 2. All activities under this component should be conducted in close cooperation and synergy with the 2016-2020 PAR Strategy and E-Services Development Concept, as well as relevant donor assistance in this area.
The expressions of interest must be sent to: annelise.godber@expertisefrance.fr

ADDRESS_REVIEW_INFO.OFFICIALNAME: Registry of the Paris Administrative Court
